document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the subgenus Metaeuops Legalov of Euops Schoenherr (Coleoptera, Curculionoidea, Attelabidae) from the Papuan region

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of the subgenus Metaeuops Legalov of Euops Schoenherr (Coleoptera, Curculionoidea, Attelabidae) from the Papuan region

subSubSection.paragraph: Elytra ferruginous or piceous, with or without slightly bluish to bronze lustre. Scutellum greenish bronze; anterior surface of procoxae ferruginous or, at most, with slight bluish lustre. Male: Apical scoop of pedon with subangulate apex. TA as in Fig. 94 ; internal support structures of ductus ejaculatorius long, passing beyond mid­level of basal sclerites, but not reaching the basal sclerites´ apical level.

East Sepik Prov. ( Torricelli Mts. ), Madang Prov. ( Erima ), Morobe Prov. ( Salawaket Range , Wau ), Central Prov. ( Brown River , Goilala ). Elevation :
50–1700 m
.

Selected male specimen (Wau). Length , pronotum + elytron: 3.03 mm . Coloration ( Fig. 11 ) black with bluish to bronze lustre; scutellum with slight greenish lustre; antennal funicle ferruginous, club black. Head . As in Fig. 35 . Gena 0.95 X as long as width of head immediately behind eyes. Contours of genae in dorsal view markedly converging anteriad. Vertex dorsally subglabrous; laterally behind eye sparsely punctate, posteriorly transversely rugulose. Eyes in dorsal view moderately prominent, set off from lateral contour of head. Profile of vertex with marked constriction immediately behind eye. Ventral surface of head in front of gular region markedly sculptured; with deep median furrow, anteriorly with sparse deep punctures becoming denser near eye, posteriorly with transverse wrinkles. Rostrum 1.96 X as long as mouthparts; at widest point 1.51 X wider than at base; in profile dorsal contour above antennal insertion with weak rounded prominence, anteriorly in sinuate line to apex; ventral contour continuous with head, in sinuate line to apex; ventrally on submentum subglabrous, with few short suberect setae. Mouthparts . Prementum [described from different specimen] at base 1.6 X wider than long, ca. 3.0 X wider than at apex; with straight lateral margins converging apicad; apical processes subangulate, of equal length, median apical process retracted into more dorsal position. Antenna slender, as in Fig. 70 . Prothorax 1.01 X as long as wide; preapical constriction shallow; disc evenly convex, shining, impunctate; sides with dense, deep punctures. Metanotum laterally roof­like extended and subangularly projecting, but without distinct lateral lobes. Elytron 2.36 X longer than wide; striae weakly impressed. Thoracic venter . Height of pterothorax 0.77 X length of elytron. Procoxa in anterior aspect 1.20 X as long as wide. Legs . Profemur subsymmetrically clavate, moderately swollen, thickest at 0.32 of length from apex, at base with indistinct stalk. Protibia evenly weakly curved ventrad; ventral contour parallel to dorsal contour. Mesotibia dorsally before apex with subangulate lobe, its apical edge leading obliquely towards uncus; overall shape of tibia subtriangular. Mesotarsus straight, 2.9 X as long as wide. Metatibia of similar size as mesotibia. Abdomen . Ventral contour anteriorly weakly concave in lateral view, sternite VI projecting bluntly angulate, with marked constriction between sternite VI and VII. Ventral surface of sternite III subglabrous, sternites IV–VI laterally with sparse subrecumbent setae, medially subglabrous; sternite VI with median swelling in front of posterior margin. Pygidium as long as wide (1.00 X); at extreme base microreticulate, remainder shining; in basal half, especially laterally, densely and deeply punctate, medially and towards apex punctures shallower and sparser. Genitalia. Apex of tergite VIII curved in evenly convex line. Sternite VIII as in Fig. 182 . Tegminal plate ( Fig. 122 ) with sides moderately converging apicad; apical edge subtruncate, densely setose with short setae. Aedeagus. Apical scoop of pedon ( Fig. 159 ) ca. 1.52 X as long as wide, with lateral margins converging in straight line; apex subangulate. Tectum as in Fig. 142 ; lateral frame converging with sinuate sides to pointed apex; subapically without extensions. TA as in Fig. 94 ; apex of frame wider than base; transfer processes basally articulated inside of frame of TA, approximately reaching frame´s apex; base of transfer processes within basal half of frame; without distinct dorsal plate; internal support structures of ductus ejaculatorius long, passing mid­level of basal sclerites; basal sclerites ca. 0.34 X of total length of TA. Cuticle of endophallus in apical 0.50 (of total length of aedeagus) with dense, subtriangular denticles; in mid portion with pair of folded sclerites; between these sclerites with few denticles such as the ones in apical portion ( Fig. 110 ).

Lectotype , female. Same as described male except: length , pronotum + elytron: 2.68 mm . Coloration ( Fig. 10 ) ferruginous except base of head black with bluish lustre, scutellum metallic green; antennal club black, funicle light ferruginous. Head . As in Fig. 48 . Gena 0.74 X as long as width of head immediately behind eyes. Profile of vertex behind eye straight, towards base rounded. Rostrum 1.86 X as long as mouthparts; at widest point 1.40 X wider than at base. Prothorax 0.97 X as long as wide. Disk at middle with very shallow transverse impression. Elytron 2.28 X longer than wide. Thoracic venter . Height of pterothorax 0.80 X length of elytron. Procoxa in anterior aspect 1.23 X as long as wide. Legs . Dorsal contour of profemur sinuate, in basal third straight, continuing in markedly convex line to apex. Protibia straight; ventral contour sinuate, basal half convex, apical half concave; ventral surface smooth except crenulate at middle, densely setose with subrecumbent to suberect setae; tibial apex with uncus and distinct premucro; premucro in ventral position. Abdomen . Setose patch of venter 1.22 X as long as wide, consisting of 3 double rows of modified setae. Pygidium 1.10 X wider than long. Genitalia. Sternite VIII as in Fig. 198 . Tergite VIII apically rounded. Spermatheca as in Fig. 210 ; basally with long siphon­like extension; slender; subisodiametric from insertion with gland to shortly before apex. Length of ductus spermathecae plus spermatheca 2.4 X as long as tergite VIII.

Length, pronotum + elytron: males 2.02–3.03 mm (n=30, =2.65 ± 0.27); females 2.13–3.09 mm (n=11, =2.60 ± 0.31); specimens from Madang province usually smaller than average. Coloration ranging from light ferruginous with bluish head to completely black with bluish lustre; in the majority of fully hardened specimens from the highlands at least elytra ferruginous; specimens from Madang (except for holotype ) darker, piceous with oily bluish lustre. Prothorax 0.94–1.02 X as long as wide in males (n=22, =0.99 ± 0.02), 0.93–0.98 X as long as wide in females (n=7, =0.96 ± 0.02). Elytron 2.09–2.45 X longer than wide in males (n=29, =2.34 ± 0.09), 2.20–2.46 X longer than wide in females (n=11, =2.32 ± 0.07); specimens from Madang province usually with elytra shorter than average. Thoracic venter. Height of pterothorax 0.69–0.82 X length of elytron in males (n=24, =0.77 ± 0.03), 0.75–0.82 X length of elytron in females (n=8, =0.79 ± 0.03). Abdomen. Contour of male venter usually somewhat concave, but almost flat in specimens from Madang province . Pygidium 0.88–1.03 X wider than long in males (n=19,
=0.94 ± 0.04), 1.02–1.13 X wider than long in females (n=8, =1.07 ± 0.05). Female patch of modified setae 1.11–1.50 X as long as wide (n=8, =1.31 ± 0.14).

Voss (1956) did not designate a holotype in the original description, nor did he make a statement about the number of specimens examined. One syntype could be located, but additional ones may exist. To ensure stability of nomenclature a lectotype is designated herein.
